definition: worthy of pride/impressive/enviable/to show contempt for others

sentences.english: That's a relief -- Apple has had an incredible run of success over the last decade.
sentences.chinese: 十年来，苹果取得了骄人的成绩，它的成功有目共睹。

sentences.english: Design Institute in the same industry is of great strength, with enviable performance.
sentences.chinese: 设计院在同行业中具有很强的实力，拥有骄人的业绩。

sentences.english: Nam Wan Tunnel ? a project proud of its safety record.
sentences.chinese: 南湾隧道项目一直保持骄人的安全纪录。

sentences.english: Loosing only to China is something they can proudly tell their friends back home…
sentences.chinese: 仅负于中国的骄人战绩也足可以告慰家乡父老了。

sentences.english: This college has a long tradition of athletic excellence.
sentences.chinese: 这所大学在田径运动方面历来成绩骄人。

sentences.english: After years of development efforts and achieved remarkable results.
sentences.chinese: 经过多年的努力发展，取得了骄人成绩。

sentences.english: To study the source of these special success and performance is of much significance.
sentences.chinese: 研究这些特殊的骄人成绩和表现的来源颇具意义。

sentences.english: After the meal, sporting a toothpick between their teeth, they will be glowing with smug satisfaction .
sentences.chinese: 他饭后衔着一根牙签，红光满面，硬是觉得可以骄人。

definition: total victory/to excel by far/name of a tank/slam
to be utterly defeated/to be routed
to advance boldly/to push ahead vigorously
to turn up one's nose/to show disdain for/to regard superciliously

to come first in triennial palace examinations (idiom, refers to the carved stone turtle head in front of the imperial palace, next to which the most successful candidate in the imperial examinations was entitled to stand)/to be the champion/to be the very best in any field
laurel/victory garland (in Greek and Western culture)
